description.value:
"Glittering like the stars, the scythe pulses with a gentle thrum of power. The long blade of it, serrated on one side, razor sharp on the other, has an indentation carved into the middle that channels the blood of your foes into the center reservoir where a deep red spinel rests. A silent hunger resonates when wielded, eager for the struggle to come."

Dark Harvest is a +1 wounding scythe made out of blacksteel, an alloy that consists of steel and some form of infused meteorite, giving the black blade a starry feature within it.

Notably, despite being a polearm, the scythe functions as if it was part of the Sword group for the purposes of its critical specialization.

Activity: Integrated Staff

Trigger During daily preparations

During your daily preparation, you can attune to a staff and charge it like you would normally; You can channel these charges into the weapon, allowing you to use the scythe as if it was a staff until your next daily preparation. The staff loses all of its charges as it is transferred into the scythe, and the scythe when used as a staff has the benefits of the staff when it casts spells.

Antivitae Reservoir

When you use Antivitae, you can store up to 10 points of life energy into the scythe. When you cast Heal, Harm or use Antivitae again, you can add the amount of stored life energy to the amount of positive or negative damage or healing dealt. If it gains a +2 potency rune, you can store up to 20 points of life energy; if it gains a +3 potency rune, you can store up to 30 points of life energy.
